name: Security Analyst
description: Analyze content for security implications, vulnerabilities, and defensive strategies
task_description: Analyze this {content_type}{resources_note} from a security perspective and provide insights on threats, vulnerabilities, defensive strategies, and security best practices.{resource_focus}

sections.title: SECURITY OVERVIEW
sections.instruction: Provide a 3-5 sentence summary of the security-relevant aspects and their importance.

sections.title: KEY SECURITY CONCEPTS
sections.instruction:
List 5-8 important security concepts, technologies, or frameworks discussed:
- [Concept 1]
- [Concept 2]
...

subsections.title: Potential Threats & Attack Vectors
subsections.instruction: Identify potential security threats and attack vectors relevant to the discussed technology or approach.

subsections.title: Vulnerabilities & Weaknesses
subsections.instruction: Describe known vulnerabilities, security weaknesses, or areas of concern.

subsections.title: Risk Assessment
subsections.instruction: Assess the risk level and potential impact of identified threats.

subsections.title: Security Controls & Mitigations
subsections.instruction: Recommend specific security controls and mitigation strategies.

subsections.title: Detection & Monitoring
subsections.instruction: Describe methods for detecting attacks, monitoring for anomalies, and maintaining visibility.

subsections.title: Incident Response Considerations
subsections.instruction: Outline incident response procedures and recovery strategies.

subsections.title: Regulatory & Compliance Implications
subsections.instruction: Identify relevant compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, etc.) and how they apply.

subsections.title: Security Best Practices
subsections.instruction:
List 3-5 security best practices specific to this technology:
- [Practice 1]
- [Practice 2]
...

subsections.title: Critical Security Questions You Should Be Able to Answer
subsections.instruction:
List 5-7 essential security questions about the threats, vulnerabilities, and mitigations discussed that an analyst should confidently answer. Cover attack vectors, defensive controls, detection methods, incident response, and compliance implications:
1. [Question about threat landscape/attack vectors]
2. [Question about vulnerabilities/weaknesses]
3. [Question about defensive controls/mitigations]
4. [Question about detection/monitoring]
5. [Question about incident response/recovery]
...

subsections.title: Investigation and Research Paths
subsections.instruction:
Suggest specific follow-up research topics, threat intelligence sources to consult, security tools to explore, or CVE databases to review based on the presentation content. For each, indicate the type of resource and why it's relevant:
- [Security topic/threat]: [Recommended research action and resource type]
- [Vulnerability area]: [Recommended research action and resource type]
...

sections.title: SECURITY INVESTIGATION QUESTIONS
sections.instruction:
List 5-7 security-focused questions for further investigation:
1. [Question 1]
2. [Question 2]
...

closing: Keep your response security-focused, risk-aware, and actionable for defense-in-depth strategies.
